I also might not be able handle their more authentic dishes because they are so mind numbingly spicy. The General's Chicken is covered in chilis and a reddish-brown sauce, which pack a small kick. The Walnut Prawns are fantastically fried and covered in an addictive, sweet mayonnaise. The potstickers are great: thick-skinned and bursting with tasty broth. So be careful not to burn yourself when eating them! My one complaint: the Mongolian Beef dish should be called Mongolian Onions since you get so many onions and so little beef. I've ordered this a few times and gotten the same beef-to-onion ratio so I'm suspecting the beef is there to merely season the onions! Smule's co-founder, Ge Wang, is a huge fan of this place. When he calls Da Sichuan, instead of saying hello, all he says is, "It's me," and they know exactly who it is. Also, Ge told me the name of the chef translated to English is Jackie Chan. I'm still not quite sure if he's trolling me...

name: Anatolian Kitchen
text: The Smule team totally loves Anatolian Kitchen. Between November 2011 when we first discovered this restaurant to the twilight of our Palo Alto office in April 2013, we placed over 60 take-out orders with 0 unhappy Smuleans! Yep - we ate from this fine place about once a week and no one ever complained!Their menu features so many great dishes that you'll have to visit several times before you even cover my favorites. Iskender's Favorite is a delicious entree consisting of lamb and beef in a buttery tomato sauce blend and a side of thick, creamy yogurt. This entree is very heavy, so you might want to share it with a dining partner! Going a bit lighter, the Moussaka Plate is a perfect confection of eggplant, lamb, beef, potato, and veggies covered in a delicious homemade tomato sauce. If you want to sample all the meats this place offers, check out the Combo Grill Plate; or if you're in the mood for fish, the perfectly tender salmon in the Grilled Salmon plate never disappoints.The meals always arrived in a very reasonable amount of time, and Don, their delivery guy, is really nice and funny. The Smule team now works out of a San Francisco office. When dinnertime rolls around I know there are many Smuleans wishing Anatolian Kitchen would deliver to our SF office!

name: Speedway Digital Printing
text: When I needed a large poster printed for a conference, I called the local shops in SoMa to get estimates. Since they were all in the same range, I went with the one closest to Smule's office: Speedway.The staff member seemed to have a lot of questions about how I wanted the poster printed, but I just told her to make the poster look super awesome, and I knew she understood what I needed. I had a feeling walking out of the store that she wasn't going to disappoint. The next day, my expectation panned out and I walked out a happy customer with a gorgeous poster. I will definitely come back here if I ever need anything professionally printed.

name: Cuisinett
text: Although french fries are Belgian in origin, this casual French restaurant makes some amazing french fries. Pay the extra buck for the truffle oil and prepare yourself for perfectly crispy fries that are absolutely addictive; I wanted to stop eating them, but couldn't help myself! My dining partner and I shared an Assiette Chasseur plate which came with a large slab of pâté, mustard, and pieces of baguette. The pâté was great although more bread would've been nice, since we weren't even halfway through the pâté when it ran out. Afterwards, I had the delicious Quiche Lorraine (bacon, onions, Gruyère) which had a crisp, yet soft crust.  My dining partner got the daily special: the French burger with brie, which came with three large, gooey slices of brie. Sometimes burgers taste like an incongruous mixture of the drier and wetter ingredients, but every piece of this burger from bread to patty came together to create a perfectly juicy confection.The desserts were good, but didn't blow us away. The molten chocolate cake was a chocolate cake with melted chocolate on top. It did come with a homemade whipped cream made with nutmeg, which was actually quite refreshing. But the cake was nothing special. I had the crème brulée, which was passable.We had a great time and I'm looking forward to trying the spicy lamb sausage sandwich on our next visit!

name: Equinox San Mateo
text: Sure, it's pretty expensive, but Equinox is a great gym and you're paying for what you get. The gym is super clean and has everything I need for my lifting, as well as plenty of cardio machines. Very rarely have I ever had to wait to use anything in the gym. There are plenty of complimentary classes, but I've only done the Vinyasa Yoga, which I enjoyed. There is also a pool on the roof that I've used a few times before accepting the fact that I'm a terribly inefficient swimmer. I could pay a trainer a lot of money to make me more efficient, but... it's a lot of money.It's the little things that really make Equinox worth it for me. The chilled Eucalyptus towels sound absolutely unnecessary but are incredibly refreshing if you're working hard. The endless supply of Kheil's shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and body lotion leave me feeling SO SMOOTH after a workout. The complementary razors in the shower room have helped me keep my abnormally large head bald and shiny for months.All staff members, from the greeter at the front desk to the staff who keep the place spotless, are extremely friendly and personable. If you're thinking about Equinox, come check it out. If the price tag scares you, try looking at it as a commitment device. You'll certainly be pushing yourself to get the most out of that extravagant monthly membership fee!

name: Teixeira’s Bakery
text: Growing up in Newark I took for granted how easy it was to find great custard cups and Portuguese rolls. Now living in California, I always look forward to visiting my family in NJ, both to see them and of course enjoy some deliciously authentic baked goods from Teixeira's Bakery!The custard cups are absolutely perfect. My college friends always looked forward to visits from my family because that meant delicious custard cups were also coming. When my roommate TJ heard they were coming "Oh god..." was all he could mutter. When my parents moved out of Newark, they even got our American neighbors hooked on custard cups; our neighbors' toddlers also look forward to my visits because there are guaranteed custard cup deliveries!I love bread, but Portuguese rolls are one-of-a-kind. I grew up on sloppy joes prepared on Portuguese rolls; they were the backbone of my lunch through most of elementary school! A toasted, buttered Portuguese roll with a glass of soymilk is my go-to breakfast when I visit home. Really, anything on a Portuguese roll transforms into something infinitely better. Growing up, whatever we had for dinner would quickly be put into a Portuguese roll and it always resulted in a delicious sandwich!My parents don't live in Newark anymore, but fortunately both of these Portuguese staples can be stored for up to a week. Throw the custard cups in the fridge and freeze and the bread, and you'll never be without these gifts from the culinary gods.

name: The Tumi Store
text: My long, arduous journey to find the perfect backpack eventually brought me to the Tumi Store near Union Square. I saw some backpacks on their website that interested me, but wanted to come check them out in person.Every staff member was really friendly and enthusiastic, answering all questions I had.When I saw a bag I liked but not in the preferred color, they called their sister store at the Westfield Mall and confirmed that the bag was in stock there. As I thanked them and was about to leave, one of the employees told me there was going to be a huge sale starting the next day and that I should go to their sister store and do a "pre-sale" on the bag to reserve it. Thanks to him, I saved a boatload on my bag purchases.I ended up going with an anthracite Alpha Bravo Travis Backpack which I absolutely love. The backpack is stylish, sturdy, has tons of compartments, and has already survived a trip to Korea! Tumi bags are pricey, but I'm hoping to get a lot of mileage out of this stylish bag!

name: Golden Gate Bakery
text: Their egg tarts are definitely the freshest I have ever had. Tasted like the Chinese lady dropped them straight from the oven into my bag! That said, growing up in a Portuguese family, I went through boxes and boxes of delicious pastéis de nata (Portuguese custard cups) so I'm partial to that style, and am actually not a huge fan of Chinese style egg tarts. My favorite item from my first trip here was the beef curry pie - a savory empanada filled with a spicy beef curry. Their cream bread disappointed me a bit, but that may be because I have recently enjoyed awesome cream bread at bakeries in Seoul. The bread's outer shell was a bit too rubbery in texture and the cream inside was not anything special.The lines get long here, but the workers are not only efficient at fulfilling orders, but also really friendly. This place is also cash-only so don't waste your time standing in line if you don't have cash!I love steamed pork buns and was looking forward to giving theirs a try. Unfortunately they were totally out and I didn't want to wait 20 minutes for the next batch. I'm definitely coming back to see if I can grab some delicious meat-filled buns!

name: The American Grilled Cheese Kitchen
text: This place takes your childhood grilled cheese and ups the ante many-many-many-manyfold. My favorite sandwich is the Jalapeño Popper featuring chèvre, Monterey jack, apricot-jalapeño relish, and applewood-smoked bacon. Every bite is an excellent mix of cheesy goodness, perfectly crispy bacon, and a little kick from the jalapeños. I usually get this as part of the The Red, White and Blue Plate Special which gives you a slightly smaller sandwich with a soup or salad. Their smoky tomato soup has been a hit-or-miss for me as sometimes it just seems too watered down. They also serve breakfast sandwiches until 11 AM on weekdays. The Smule team absolutely loves them. My favorite is the Breakfast Piglet which features sharp cheddar, ham, apple mustard, and rosemary butter on delicious levain bread. And just when you thought these guys were a one-trick-grilled-cheese-sandwich pony, you realize they also do baked goods amazingly well. Their muffins, especially the berry-infused ones, are great. My favorite is the blueberry and raspberry muffin, which is filled with whole berries. They bake them in the morning, but sometimes they have some left over that you can grab at lunchtime.During lunch, the line extends out the door so avoid coming at exactly noon if you are in a rush. They have seating inside and outside. Although all the seating might be taken as you arrive, something usually frees up while you are waiting for your food to come out.

name: Cha Cha Sushi
text: Oh my, this place is absolutely amazing! If you're a sushi purist (snob) or want a traditional sushi experience, this probably isn't the place for you. But if you want a unique melt-in-your-mouth experience, Cha Cha is the place for you!Their special rolls prove that you can't go wrong if you go big with your rolls and add in some frying and baking. Take my personal favorite, the Alaskan Crispy, a deep fried salmon and cream cheese roll topped with wasabi mayo, unagi sauce and tobiko. As a piece melts in my mouth, my arteries cry out in pain as they are slowly clogged with a rich mixture of cream cheese and salmon. Worth it! I really enjoy their baked rolls which both start out life as a simple California Roll: the Lion King adds tender baked salmon, and the Ocean Side adds succulent baked scallops. Even rolls that I did not particularly fall in love with, like the spicy tuna-based Sparky, are delicious. The Sparky actually ranked very highly with my dining partners and I totally did not regret having three pieces of it! On my most recent visit, we gave the dessert menu a try and just when I was convinced Cha Cha could only provide an amazing experience via their sushi rolls, I was proven wrong. The vanilla tempura ice cream, covered in a thick pie-like crust with a dollop of whipped cream was absolutely delicious. The tempura ice cream can also comfortably feed four as it is a nicely sized breaded ball cut into four pieces. The menu should aptly rename the green tea ice cream to Goblet of Green Tea Ice Cream as it was served in a giant goblet and fed four of us with some left to spare. The mochi ice cream (one order cut into four pieces) is also above average. Do note that they drizzle chocolate sauce on all their dessert items. We have had some waiters ask and some not, but if you're not a fan of chocolate like me or don't want chocolate distracting your taste buds, just ask for them to not put chocolate on your dessert items!They are wildly popular and busy, and they don't take reservations -- so expect a bit of a wait even if you come on a weekday. Two people can usually get seated within 15 minutes, especially if you don't mind sitting at the sushi bar. I have found coming with four people is the way to go for maximizing the amount of rolls you get to try as most rolls come cut into eight pieces. Expect a slightly longer wait if your party is larger, especially if you want a table. That said, whether we have had to wait 30 minutes or an hour, once we're seated and eating no one seems to mention the wait ever again!The restaurant is clean, well-maintained and the service is great. The rolls come out ridiculously fast even when the place is packed -- so if you had to wait a while to be seated, do not fret as your wait will be quickly rewarded. The complimentary spicy mussels and green tea add a nice touch to an already amazing and ridiculously economical experience. Rolls range in price but average around $10 per roll. If you love your friends and family, bring them here. You owe it to them. And for being such a good person, you will be rewarded as well!

name: Panda Dumpling
text: After I told a coworker about my new addiction to dumplings and dim sum, she recommended I come check this place out. Some people might be put off by how close in name this restaurant is to a Chinese fast food chain, but don't let that turn you off! I stopped by for lunch with some friends and we fell in love during our first visit and try to stop by here at least once a month to get some tasty dumplings and dim sum.If you're getting dumplings, go with the freshly handmade crab/pork soup dumplings (xiaolongbao) and skip over their other dumplings that are frozen. The soup dumplings are absolutely delicious. They come out piping hot, so give it a minute, then get the dumpling in your mouth, close your eyes, and prepare to bite down and release an amazing mixture of broth, pork, and crab! Yum!Some of my other favorite items on the menu include their tasty chive pancakes which are empanada-like in structure. Lightly fried to perfection, they're filled with scrambled egg, chives, and rice noodle. You basically get two "empanadas" cut in half so this can comfortably feed four. Their pork buns are savory and are not filled with the traditional sweet pork you normally get in steamed buns, but they are great nonetheless. Their spicy wontons are also great - actually pretty spicy and drenched in a thick peanut sauce.They also do entree dishes, but we haven't explored that side of the menu very thoroughly though we did get an eggplant entree once which we both enjoyed!The decor isn't anything to brag about but the restaurant is clean and the staff has always been friendly and attentive during our many visits.The absolute worst part about eating here is we have both honed in on our absolutely favorite items leaving very little room to experiment. Fortunately, we've realized that bringing along family and friends gives us more mouths to feed and more opportunity to explore their menu!
